page.title: 16WOODLANDS OF THE COTSWOLDS
page.content: Our area contains a lot of woodland we tried to identify the trees in four areas of woodland. {1. LAYCOMBE DITCH WOOD }covered the side of a hill, it is a mixed wood containing coniferous and deciduous trees. These included: Beech Sycamore Elder Oak Horse Chestnut Holly Hawthorn Various Pines {2. MONKCOMBE WOOD and GOLDEN KNOLL {WOOD}were also sloping, mixed woods in which we saw: Ash Oak Beech Hawthorn Elder Pines Elm Holly Horse Chestnut Sycamore {3. WESTFIELD BRAKE }is higher up the same slope as Golden Knoll Wood and contained similar trees.
